snippet: Marine parks say the imports are needed for breeding and research, but approval would end an import hiatus of nearly two decades.
abstract: Proposal to import 18 beluga whales for popular interactive park attractions in the United States is drawing fierce opposition from animal rights advocates and others who object to their removal from the wild; Georgia Aquarium, which would own belugas, says imports are needed for breeding and research.

byline.contributor: Nikolay Khalip contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Marine parks say the imports are needed for breeding and research, but approval would end an import hiatus of nearly two decades.

headline.seo: Strong Opposition to Aquarium’s Plan to Import Beluga Whales
headline.main: Opposition as Aquarium Seeks Import of Whales
headline.print_headline: Opposition As Aquarium Seeks Import Of Whales
